"},{"name":"updaterFullName","value":"Chris Heywood"},{"name":"reporterName","value":"garthpmurray"},{"name":"commentsCount","value":"2"},{"name":"updaterName","value":"ch"},{"name":"markdown","value":"true"},{"name":"wikified","value":"true"},{"name":"votes","value":"0"},{"name":"updated","value":"1596185993937"},{"name":"State","value":["In Progress"],"valueId":["In Progress"],"color":null},{"name":"Sprints","value":["July 27 - Aug 7"],"valueId":["July 27 - Aug 7"],"color":null},{"name":"Type","value":["Bug"],"valueId":["Bug"],"color":null},{"name":"Priority","value":["Normal"],"valueId":["Normal"],"color":{"bg":"#e6f6cf","fg":"#4da400"}},{"name":"Story points","value":["4"],"valueId":["4"],"color":null},{"name":"Assignee","value":[{"value":"ch","fullName":"Chris Heywood"}]}],"comment":[{"id":"4-134","author":"garthpmurray","authorFullName":"Garth Murray","issueId":"OD-100","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"

Here is the step function execution I found was causing issues

https://console.aws.amazon.com/states/home?region=us-east-1#/executions/details/arn:aws:states:us-east-1:293415089511:execution:OnDemandAddAttachments:be12a3e1-4b7d-46e8-9113-1dfdf4fb20ad

","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1595945829246,"updated":0,"permittedGroup":null,"markdown":true,"replies":[]},{"id":"4-201","author":"ch","authorFullName":"Chris Heywood","issueId":"OD-100","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"

I've identified that this was due to a quota applying to AWS step functions - https://docs.aws.amazon.com/step-functions/latest/dg/limits.html#service-limits-task-executions - where there's a limit of 32,768 characters for the JSON state passed from one task to another.
When a large number of photos was being processed, particularly when some of them were causing Xact errors by there being "illegal" characters in their filenames, the overall result state being passed between task steps was exceeding the 32,768 quota, mainly when processing the final outcome to pass back to OnDemand.
I've now optimised the JSON state data passed between tasks to reduce its size so batches of up to approx. 150 attachments should be processed without the quota being exceeded.
As has been discussed with @Garth Murray, it will be advisable to set some limit in OnDemand on the number of attachments that can be sent at once to Xact, e.g. perhaps not more than 150 per batch, particularly sicne it's recently been observed that photos are being sent of between 5MB and 7MB each, so sending a batch of 100 of those is a significant amount of data to be transferring to Xact (and the Xact API is very slow to receive/process each individual attachment).

Job Statuses are not updating. The just stay as Unassigned unless we manually move them. The need to update and data is put in. If I assign a field inspector, it should move to assigned. If the FI puts in an appointment D/T, it should move to Appointment Scheduled etc…..

Clarification needed - where is the source of truth for statuses (isn’t it Xact)?

Should this be a separate status column?

"},{"name":"updaterFullName","value":"Justin Cook"},{"name":"reporterName","value":"garthpmurray"},{"name":"commentsCount","value":"6"},{"name":"updaterName","value":"jcook@globalrisksolutions.com"},{"name":"markdown","value":"true"},{"name":"wikified","value":"true"},{"name":"votes","value":"0"},{"name":"updated","value":"1596143281059"},{"name":"State","value":["In Progress"],"valueId":["In Progress"],"color":null},{"name":"Sprints","value":["July 27 - Aug 7"],"valueId":["July 27 - Aug 7"],"color":null},{"name":"Type","value":["Task"],"valueId":["Task"],"color":null},{"name":"Priority","value":["Normal"],"valueId":["Normal"],"color":{"bg":"#e6f6cf","fg":"#4da400"}},{"name":"Story points","value":["3"],"valueId":["3"],"color":null},{"name":"Assignee","value":[{"value":"garthpmurray","fullName":"Garth Murray"}]},{"name":"attachments","value":[{"value":"Status Mapping.xlsx","id":"7-33","url":"https://youtrack.globalrisksolutions.com:443/api/files/7-33?sign=MTU5NjQxMjgwMDAwMHwxLTF8Ny0zM3xrbmJ4elljZDZSb2VhZ1YxdzhDaEhRc1VLam1HTEJPWjZ1%0D%0AZjE5ZzM1YjdJDQo%0D%0A&updated=1596043498775"}]}],"comment":[{"id":"4-116","author":"garthpmurray","authorFullName":"Garth Murray","issueId":"OD-89","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"

If SFI is carrier_id 2

DELETE FROM assignment_api_statuses WHERE assignment_id NOT IN (select id from assignments WHERE carrier_id = 2);  
DELETE FROM assignment_building_codes WHERE assignment_id NOT IN (select id from assignments WHERE carrier_id = 2);  
DELETE FROM assignment_canopy_data WHERE assignment_id NOT IN (select id from assignments WHERE carrier_id = 2); 
DELETE FROM assignment_documents WHERE assignment_id NOT IN (select id from assignments WHERE carrier_id = 2);
DELETE FROM assignment_photos WHERE assignment_id NOT IN (select id from assignments WHERE carrier_id = 2);
DELETE FROM assignment_property_data WHERE assignment_id NOT IN (select id from assignments WHERE carrier_id = 2);
DELETE FROM assignment_weather_histories WHERE assignment_id NOT IN (select id from assignments WHERE carrier_id = 2);
DELETE FROM assignment_weathers WHERE assignment_id NOT IN (select id from assignments WHERE carrier_id = 2);
DELETE FROM mobile_answers WHERE assignment_id NOT IN (select id from assignments WHERE carrier_id = 2);
DELETE FROM mobile_buildings WHERE assignment_id NOT IN (select id from assignments WHERE carrier_id = 2);
DELETE FROM mobile_inspections WHERE assignment_id NOT IN (select id from assignments WHERE carrier_id = 2);
DELETE FROM mobile_rooms WHERE assignment_id NOT IN (select id from assignments WHERE carrier_id = 2);
DELETE FROM mobile_section_assignment WHERE assignment_id NOT IN (select id from assignments WHERE carrier_id = 2);
DELETE FROM user_assignments WHERE assignment_id NOT IN (select id from assignments WHERE carrier_id = 2);
DELETE FROM weather_data WHERE assignment_id NOT IN (select id from assignments WHERE carrier_id = 2);
DELETE FROM xactimate_assignments WHERE assignment_id NOT IN (select id from assignments WHERE carrier_id = 2);
DELETE FROM air_map_airspace_advisories WHERE assignment_id NOT IN (select id from assignments WHERE carrier_id = 2);
DELETE FROM ondemandapp_build.assignments WHERE carrier_id != 2;

Inspection name - user assigned, whichever one of these is not null

    /**
     * @return HasOneThrough
     */
    public function dronePilot () {
        return $this->userAssignment()
                    ->where(['type' => UserAssignments::TYPE_DRONE]);
    }
    
    /**
     * @return HasOneThrough
     */
    public function fieldInspector () {
        return $this->userAssignment()
                    ->where(['type' => UserAssignments::TYPE_FIELD]);
    }

Slope inspection data - pull from Roof Inspection information, mobile answers
Building Stories from Estated - Pulled as soon as the assignment is created

","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1595516733368,"updated":0,"permittedGroup":null,"markdown":true,"replies":[]},{"id":"4-127","author":"Kanolfo","authorFullName":"Kris Anolfo","issueId":"OD-80","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"

Chris set up the Xact to TrackVia integration so most of the needed data is already pushing. The missing pieces are:

For the Field Inspectors / Drone Resources -  Their name should be pushed from the On Demand Web Application into a field in TrackVia called Field Resource

The pitch and story data from the Property API need to be pushed into pitch and story fields in TrackVia

","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1595857168907,"updated":0,"permittedGroup":null,"markdown":true,"replies":[]},{"id":"4-128","author":"garthpmurray","authorFullName":"Garth Murray","issueId":"OD-80","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"

Do you have an endpoint or api documentation we can see so we can start building out this piece?

","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1595857788326,"updated":0,"permittedGroup":null,"markdown":true,"replies":[]},{"id":"4-131","author":"Kanolfo","authorFullName":"Kris Anolfo","issueId":"OD-80","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"

I have the website for TrackVia's documentation, but (not surprisingly) we don't have internal documentation on how we use it. Chris has always handled our TrackVia stuff so he should be able to help us if we need to reach out. Otherwise these are TrackVia's docs -- https://developer.trackvia.com/livedocs

","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1595876132918,"updated":0,"permittedGroup":null,"markdown":true,"replies":[]},{"id":"4-135","author":"garthpmurray","authorFullName":"Garth Murray","issueId":"OD-80","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"

I just want to confirm we are holding off on this till Falin has a chance to weigh in correct?

","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1595946273112,"updated":0,"permittedGroup":null,"markdown":true,"replies":[]},{"id":"4-136","author":"Kanolfo","authorFullName":"Kris Anolfo","issueId":"OD-80","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"

We're holding off until @Chris Heywood has time to work on it, likely a few days from now. I'm not sure how much input we need from Falin, it's mostly getting the bits of data from all the places (web app, weather API, Xact) and getting them into TrackVia. I think the one hiccup in this process is needing a unique identifier for each inspector which Chris will likely talk to us about once he has the time.

","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1595950409810,"updated":0,"permittedGroup":null,"markdown":true,"replies":[]},{"id":"4-169","author":"ch","authorFullName":"Chris Heywood","issueId":"OD-80","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"

Hey @Kris Anolfo, I can't find details of the billing calc that is gonna need to be done in TV using the stories, pitch & field inspector / drone resource information.
Wondering if we're gonna need the stories / pitch to be numeric? E.g. if the billing calc is gonna include anything like stories >= where it relies on doing numeric operation?
In the OnDemand MySQL database I'm seeing that assignment_property_data has the stories/pre_dominate_pitch/steepest_pitch columns as varchar(255) data types, although where the stories has so far been populated so far it's actually numeric (there are no examples of the pitch columns being populated so far).
Any thoughts on how we'll need the data to be structured in TV? E.g. are simple text values going to be adequate?

","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1596109458935,"updated":1596109694970,"permittedGroup":null,"markdown":true,"replies":[]},{"id":"4-170","author":"ch","authorFullName":"Chris Heywood","issueId":"OD-80","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"

Hey again @Kris Anolfo, on a similar note, what data do we need stored on each claim in TV for the field inspector / drone resource? For example, for each claim in TV we could just have:

  • Field Inspector ID
  • Field Inspector Name
  • Drone Resource ID
  • Drone Resource Name
    Each of those IDs could maybe just be the id from the users table in the OnDemand MySQL database (since that's where this info is gonna be coming from to start with).
    Or is there a bunch of other info that would be needed for billing? E.g. an actual Employee ID and/or each person's email address or other stuff?
    If there are many additional data points needed for each person then we'll need to decide whether we handle that by either:
  1. adding those data points into the OnDemand database so it can send that info over to TV for each claim; or
  2. setting up a central, linked table in TV that stores this info for each person but with a sync process or link identifier to hook into the OnDemand database, e.g. so TV gets a user ID from OnDemand and can link that to its person table to infer the other data points.
    Option 1 seems like it might be easiest/best but it would rely it being possible to maintain that data in the OnDemand app (it limits our reliance on maintaining key data in TV though?).
","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1596112161020,"updated":0,"permittedGroup":null,"markdown":true,"replies":[]},{"id":"4-171","author":"ch","authorFullName":"Chris Heywood","issueId":"OD-80","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"

Another consideration on this is that for each carrier in OnDemand it's ideally going to need to tell any new API I set-up what the relevant TrackVia "View ID" is when it's sending over any claim data. The TV API will need that because these claims are stored in separate client apps/tables in TrackVia, e.g. there's a different app and different table/view for SFI versus other clients, etc. So, maybe, the carriers table in OnDemand is going to need to have a tv_view_id column added to it so it can pass that along with any request to update a claim in TV.

","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1596113861453,"updated":0,"permittedGroup":null,"markdown":true,"replies":[]},{"id":"4-172","author":"garthpmurray","authorFullName":"Garth Murray","issueId":"OD-80","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"

Roof Pitch is stored in another table in a JSON column. mobile_inspections:data where name is InspectionStepRoofBasic Comes in as a fraction. 1/2, 9/12, etc

","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1596114096655,"updated":0,"permittedGroup":null,"markdown":true,"replies":[]},{"id":"4-174","author":"Kanolfo","authorFullName":"Kris Anolfo","issueId":"OD-80","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"

I'm dropping these instructions I received from Falin in here for our discussion about this:

Billing
Each file will be billed at $300 per file for the pilot and then $385 after the pilot. It may make sense to have drop down and do a calculated field that will reduce if that drop down says (pilot).   We will be automatically generating the billing invoices from the On Demand System -> XA but need to track for A/R

Fees
For the Field Inspectors / Drone Resources -  their name/email should be pushed from the On Demand Web Application (it will be attached to the specific claim number)

For the Desk Adjuster - their information will push over as the XACTNET address.  So Maxwell or whoever will need to continue to add adjusters to that linked XACTNET Adjusters app

Calculated Fee to be paid to Field Inspector / Drone Resources:
1 Story Inspection: $95.00
2 Stories or More: $20.00 add on
Pitch > 7/12: $40 add on

For Example:  2 Story 9/12 Roof would be $155.

Flat Fee to be paid to the Desk Adjuster:

$95.00 per file

Murray"},{"name":"created","value":"1595602033695"},{"name":"numberInProject","value":"90"},{"name":"description","value":"

Contact date/time, Appointment D/T and Inspected D/T are all collected in the mobile app and push into the DB. We need this data to: Need to poll mobile db to pull this

Push in to XA for each claim so the carrier sees this info Chris to build API

Push into GRS On Demand so we know what is going on with each file without having to go into XA each time Will happen automatically

Currently we have columns for Assigned, Appointment, Inspected and Completed. We need to add Contacted. Web app update needed

Appointment D/T are pushing through, but they are always 2 hours early. Maybe just a setting that needs to be updated.
